Hubert Leo

Baltimore, USA · Jakarta, Indonesia · (+62) 811 911-9458 · hleo1@jhu.edu

Hi! I am current a student at Johns Hopkins University majoring in Computer Science. On the side I tutor high school students in Physics and Math and specialize in the IBDP curriculum. I also work as a freelance web developer specializing in the MEAN tech stack. I love contributing to companies with high impact projects.

Experience

Head Web Developer Intern

Regenize South Africa

Helped design and build the first iteration of Regenize's web and app development platform that tries to incentivize South Africans to recycle and develop environmentally friendly practices by rewarding them with 'Remali', a virtual currency that can be traded for rewards like phone data and internet and vouchers for the supermarket.

July 2019 - August 2019

Research Assistant

Terradynamics Laboratory at JHU

Modelled cockroach traversal through beams using MATLAB. Designed a mesocosm environment for cockroaches in order to determine whether cockroaches learn to travel through eassier terrain. Designed, built and programmed a snake robot that traverse through beams using Dynamixel Servos, self-designed 3D parts, and programmed through Open CM 9.04.

October 2018 - July 2019

Data Analytics

Jakarta Smart City

Modeled pollution trends gathered from Jakarta’s Environmental Department’s sensors and the U.S. Embassy’s pollution database. Worked on policy to limit factories surrounding residential areas and proposed to employ LEED-certified housing for future government housing complexes.

July 2018 - August 2018

Entrepreneurship

cofounder and tech lead

Poof Laundry at JHU

Developing a student run buisness that picks up and delivers student laundry right to their doorstep within their dormitories. In the process of developing a mobile application for students to conviniently order through a web browser or their smartphone.

January 2019 - Present

cofounder

Drops for Crops Hydroponics Jakarta

Founded a non-profit focused on providing hydroponics to low-income communities for their benefit. Within a year, provided two functioning hydroponics system in an elderly home facility and government built housing in North Jakarta, providing free home-grown nutritious vegetables for these communities.

May 2014 - May 2016

Interests

Apart from doing university and freelance related work, I enjoy exploring new cities and travelling with friends and family. I love exploring streetfood in my time in South East Asia and the different cuisines in Baltimore's diverse neighbourhoods.

I love playing strategy and city building games and am an avid follower of the Sid Meier's Civilization series. One of my goals in life is to learn at least one topic in every field of study, and every month I choose a new topic. Check out my blog for what I'm up to this month!
